game.name: Sd Gundam Generation - Ichinen Sensouki
game.desc: It is a video game adaptation of the series based on the Mobile Suit Gundam anime, specifically Super Deformed Gundam. This is the first in a series of six video games called SD Gundam Generation1,2.

game.path: ./No-Intro/Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Sailor Stars - Fuwafuwa Panic 2 (Japan).st
game.name: Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon S - Fuwa Fuwa Panic 2
game.desc: Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Super S: Fuwa Fuwa Panic is a Sailor Moon themed competitive puzzle game. Players first select a character from among five Sailor Scouts and Chibiusa, each with a unique special move. They will then challenge each other in competition. Each player has a board which contains some balloons, in either red, yellow, green or blue. These balloons can be shot at in order to gain points and fill up the power bar. Balloons of the same color that are adjacent to one another with all be destroyed and generate more points. The goal is to avoid being the player whose balloons are pushed downwards off the board, and to make the opponent receive this fate. As groups of balloons are destroyed, they can reveal power-ups as well as produce black balloons on the opponent's board. Black balloons can only be destroyed by groups of colored balloons being removed adjacent to them. Players with a filled power bar can unleash special abilities.
game.image: ./images/Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Sailor Stars - Fuwafuwa Panic 2 (Japan)-image.jpg
game.video: ./videos/Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Sailor Stars - Fuwafuwa Panic 2 (Japan)-video.mp4

game.boxback: ./images/Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Sailor Stars - Fuwafuwa Panic 2 (Japan)-boxback.png

game.name: Crayon Shin-chan - Nagagutsu Dobon!!
game.desc: Crayon Shin-Chan: Nagagutsu Dobon! ("Crayon Shin-Chan: Galoshes Splash!!") is an action game. It is based on the anime Crayon Shin-Chan. The goal of the game is to make puddles splash and soak the opponents. The puddles have their own specificities depending on their size. Taking advantage of their layout is the key to getting the opponents to get wet. There are also bonuses that the player can collect during the game.

game.name: Gegege No Kitarou - Youkai Donjara
game.desc: A board game which required a Sufami Turbo

game.name: Gekisou Sentai Car Rangers
game.desc: Gekisou Sentai Carranger: Zenkai! Racer Senshi Gekiso Sentai Karenja Zenkai! Resa Senshi?, Racing Squadron Carranger: Full Force! Racer Warrior) is the licensed video game of the Carranger series. It was released in Japan by Bandai in 1996, and required the Sufami Turbo accessory. Despite the fact that Carranger was adapted into Power Rangers: Turbo, the game was never brought to the North American market as such because, by the time Turbo premiered in 1997, the Nintendo 64 had been on North American shores for several months. The N64 had only just come out in Japan when the game was released, so not everyone had switched yet.

game.name: Poi Poi Ninja World
game.desc:
Poi Poi Ninja World is a Bomberman-like multiplayer game in which players try to do in their opponents by tossing bombs, rocks, and other objects.
Poi Poi Ninja World could be linked with other Poi Poi Ninja World carts inserted into the second slot of the Sufami Turbo, allowing the exchange of various save data.

game.name: Sd Gundam Generation - Axis Senki
game.desc: SD Gundam Generation: Axis Senki , also called SD Gundam Generation C, is a strategy video game developed and published by Bandai in August 1996 for Super Nintendo. It is a video game adaptation of the series based on the anime Mobile Suit Gundam and especially Super Deformed Gundam. It is the third opus of a series of six video games called SD Gundam Generation.

game.name: Sd Gundam Generation - Babylonia Kenkoku Senki
game.desc: It is a video game adaptation of the series based on the anime Mobile Suit Gundam and especially Super Deformed Gundam. It is the fourth opus of a series of six video games called SD Gundam Generation

game.name: Sd Gundam Generation - Colony Kakutouki
game.desc: It is a video game adaptation of the anime series Mobile Suit Gundam and specifically Super Deformed Gundam. It is the latest installment in a series of six video games called SD Gundam Generation 1.

game.name: Sd Gundam Generation - Gryps Senki
game.desc: It is the second of six SD Gundam Generation games released for the Sufami Turbo peripheral, which uses smaller carts that can communicate with each other when inserted into the Sufami Turbo device.

game.name: Sd Gundam Generation - Zanscare Senki
game.desc: SD Gundam Generation: Zanscare Senki ("Record of Zanscare War") is a licensed strategy game for the Super Famicom. It draws its conflicts and characters from the Mobile Suit Victory Gundam series. It is the fifth of six SD Gundam Generation games released for the Sufami Turbo peripheral, which uses smaller carts that can communicate with each other when inserted into the Sufami Turbo device.

game.name: Sd Ultra Battle - Seven Densetsu
game.desc:
SD Ultra Battle: Seven Densetsu ("SD Ultra Battle: Seven Legend") is a fighter game for the Super Famicom that features super deformed characters from the Ultra Seven series, itself a follow-up to the original Ultraman tokusatsu show.
Along with series protagonist Ultraseven, the game also features major kaiju villains Eleking and King Joe as playable characters.
The game was a companion product to SD Ultra Battle: Ultraman Densetsu, and was released the same day. Both carts employ Bandai's officially licensed Nintendo peripheral the Sufami Turbo to link together to share game data, allowing characters from one game to appear and fight characters in the other. Because Seven Densetsu was released in the miniature Sufami Turbo cartridge format, it cannot be played without that peripheral.

game.name: Sd Ultra Battle - Ultraman Densetsu
game.desc:
SD Ultra Battle: Ultraman Densetsu ("SD Ultra Battle: Ultraman Legend") is a fighter game for the Super Famicom that features super deformed characters from the Ultraman series. Along with series protagonist Ultraman, the game also features two of his most memorable opponents Alien Baltan and the Red King.
The game was a companion product to SD Ultra Battle: Seven Densetsu, and was released the same day. Both carts employ Bandai's officially licensed Nintendo peripheral the Sufami Turbo to link together to share game data, allowing characters from one game to appear and fight characters in the other. Because Ultraman Densetsu was released in the miniature Sufami Turbo cartridge format, it cannot be played without that peripheral. One version of Ultraman Densetsu included the Sufami Turbo peripheral as a pack-in bundle.
